main event: Observation of an object similar to the Echo I satellite in Diboll, Texas on November 1, 1961
interesting points: The object was observed for several minutes traveling in a northerly direction before suddenly disappearing when it was in the northern sky at a low angle.
The object could not be distinguished from a star of 2nd magnitude except for its motion.
The observer thought the object might be a satellite, but said it suddenly disappeared in a way that was not typical of a satellite.
The observer had previously observed the Echo I satellite on multiple occasions and noted that the observed object had similar characteristics.
The observer was a professional engineer who had graduate education, indicating he was likely a reliable witness.
result: Possibly Echo I satellite, but the sudden disappearance was considered unusual
sighted object: A bright light in the sky that moved steadily north before suddenly disappearing
